info.title: Domino Keep PIM API (quattro)
info.description: Unified API for eMail, calendar, contacts and task for a HCL Domino backend

/addresslookup.summary: Retrieve information from one or more addresssbooks

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many results shall be returned, Default = 50

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query what shall be searched

parameters.name: fulltext
parameters.description:
Should the query search Names beginning with (fulltext missing or false)
or Names containing the seatch string

post.description: Use a DQL query to find addresses

parameters.name: directoryid
parameters.description: Name of the directory that contains the entry. If omitted main addressbook is used

parameters.name: mailboxid
parameters.description:
Optional, when omitted the default mailbox of the authenticated user is addressed. Only used in delegation access when owner and user are different.
Could be: replicaid, filepath or owner shortname or email

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: When set to true, an extensive search across all addressbooks will be launched. Results get potentially cached

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
How many of the result entries shall be skipped.
Used for pagination. Default is 0

parameters.name: count
parameters.description:
How many entries shall be maximal returned?
Default is 1000

/label/{labelid}.summary: Information about a folder/label, NOT list of entries
/label/{labelid}.description:
Labels a.k.a folders
A message can have 0:n labels (Verse/gMail lingo)
or be in 0:n folders (Notes)

In outlook there's only one folder, they search

200.description: Folder info with "parent", childcount, messagecount, unid

get.description: Includes UNID, potential parent etc

parameters.name: documentdeletion
parameters.description:
Decide what to do with documents in the folder.
Options:
- NONE : no documents get deleted
- LASTFOLDER : delete documents that are in no other folder
- ALL : Delete all documents in that folder (USE at your own risk)

delete.description:
Removes a folder/label from the mail databases.
Does not delete documents unless explicitly asked

requestBody.description: List of labelids to be moved

value.Move Status: Successful move of 1 folders to label B3E63E5F418514CF48258581003828B0

patch.description: Move the labels / folders / views. Moving to folders needs to have unid as labelId and for root level will need to use %28%24Root%29($Root)

parameters.description: Unique ID of a label/folder

Optional, when omitted the default mailbox of the authenticated user is addressed. Only used in delegation access when owner and user are different.
Could be: replicaid, filepath or owner shortname or email

requestBody.description:
Fields to update on the supplied unid notebook entry

Sample:
```
{
    "DiaryDate": "2020-07-14T13:00:00.000-04:00",
    "Subject": "TEST FROM API: I am the updated subject",
    "Body": "I am the updated body",
    "Categories": ["Cat3", "Cat4"]
}
```

Notes:
1. All fields are optional
2. `Categories`:
    - value can be either a `String` or an `Array` of `Strings` for multiple categories
    - `"Categories": "CAT1"` and `"Categories": ["CAT1"]` will produce equal results but will become `Text` and `Text List` notes datatypes respectively.
    - categories, if supplied, will replaced the categories in the note (not add to the list of existing categories)
3. `DiaryDate` will default to current date/time when supplied as an empty value
4. `DiaryDate` string will be parsed with format of `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX`

put.summary: Updates the content of a notebook entry

parameters.name: mailboxid
parameters.description:
Optional, when omitted the default mailbox of the authenticated user is addressed. Only used in delegation access when owner and user are different.
Could be: replicaid, filepath or owner shortname or email

HOw many of the result entries shall be skipped.
Used for pagination. Default is 0

parameters.name: count
parameters.description:
How many entries shall be maximal returned?
Default is 1000

get.summary: Gets a list of notebook entries

requestBody.description:
A new Notebook entry

Sample:
```
{
    "DiaryDate": "2020-07-08T16:00:00.000-04:00",
    "Subject": "TEST FROM API: I am the subject",
    "Body": "I am the body",
    "Categories": ["Cat1", "Cat2"]
}
```

Notes:
1. All fields are optional
2. `Categories`:
    - value can be either a `String` or an `Array` of `Strings` for multiple categories
    - `"Categories": "CAT1"` and `"Categories": ["CAT1"]` will produce equal results but will become `Text` and `Text List` notes datatypes respectively.
3. `DiaryDate` will default to current date/time when supplied as an empty value
4. `DiaryDate` string will be parsed with format of `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX`

value.Subject: TEST FROM API: I am the subject
TEST FROM API: I am the subject

/taskresponses.summary: Path used to manage the list of taskresponses.
/taskresponses.description: The REST endpoint/path used to list and create zero or more `TaskResponse` entities.  This path contains a `GET` and `POST` operation to perform the list and create tasks, respectively.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `TaskResponse` entities.

get.description: Gets a list of all `TaskResponse` entities.

post.description: Creates a new instance of a `TaskResponse`.

/taskresponses/{taskresponseId}.summary: Path used to manage a single TaskResponse.
/taskresponses/{taskresponseId}.description: The REST endpoint/path used to get, update, and delete single instances of an `TaskResponse`.  This path contains `GET`, `PUT`, and `DELETE` operations used to perform the get, update, and delete tasks, respectively.

get.description: Gets the details of a single instance of a `TaskResponse`.

parameters.name: taskresponseId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a `TaskResponse`.

/calendarresponse/{calid}/{calentryid}/.summary: Calendar responses, incoming or outgoing with actions or action result
/calendarresponse/{calid}/{calentryid}/.description: Methods to deal with reponses to meetings, get and update them

200.description: List of responses, might be empty

get.summary: provides an array of responses to a meeting sent
get.description: Accepted, Rejected, Counter Proposed, Penciled in etc.

200.description: Creates a response to an invitation

/labels.description: Interact with label / folder information - mail only1

get.description: Info on what labels, how many documents are in there

parameters.name: mailboxid
parameters.description:
Optional, when omitted the default mailbox of the authenticated user is addressed. Only used in delegation access when owner and user are different.
Could be: replicaid, filepath or owner shortname or email

parameters.name: includeSystemLabels
parameters.description: Shall hidden and system Labels be included. Default = no

parameters.name: includeUnreadCount
parameters.description: Shall the number of unread documents be reported back

/labels/all.summary: Provides folder/label info for all PIM types
/labels/all.description: Interact with folder information from calendar, mail, contacts, tasks and Journal

get.description: Info on what labels, how many documents are in there

parameters.name: mailboxid
parameters.description:
Optional, when omitted the default mailbox of the authenticated user is addressed. Only used in delegation access when owner and user are different.
Could be: replicaid, filepath or owner shortname or email

parameters.name: includeSystemLabels
parameters.description: Shall hidden and system Labels be included. Default = no

parameters.name: includeUnreadCount
parameters.description: Shall the number of unread documents be reported back

ISODate.description:
Date/Time String in ISO 8601 format. Defined here:
https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html
see also:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

count.description: Number of documents with this label. Does not include sublabels

isSystem.description: Is this a mandatory label/folder/view e.g. Inbox, Sent, All, Drafts

name.description:
Name of Folder/Label. When the name contains a backslash,
it is a sublabel (Level = Number of backslashes)
Parent label might not exist

type.description: What type of folder/label is that (tentative): mail, contacts, tasks, calendar, journal

MailboxInfo.title: Root Type for MailboxInfo
MailboxInfo.description: Informationa about an individual mailbox. Might be accessed by mailbox owner or delegates

Title.description: Title of Mailbox. Typically the Owner's name

delegates.description:
List of people who have access
(TODO: revisit data type)

MessageBody.title: Root Type for MessageBody
MessageBody.description:
Actual content of a message.
Inspired from here:
https://developers.google.com/gmail/api/v1/reference/users/messages/attachments#resource

MessageHeaders.description:
Reflects MIMEPart in MIME messages. Composed of a header and a body,
carries a Mime Type. Each message has one root Message part,
that may contain 0:n MessageParts. Inception long before the movie
Inspired by:
https://developers.google.com/gmail/api/v1/reference/users/messages

Content-Type.description: RFC2045 - description what type of content the part is: typical values are Mime/multipart, text/html, text/plain, multipart/related, multipart/mixed as well as binary formats

additionalProperties.description: Additional header values not enumerated here, Notes fields

MessageListItemArray.description: Entry in a message list, can be String, Date or Number -- or an array of those

MimeHeaderValue.description:
RFC 2231 suggests Mime header values are text only.
However for the purpose of processing they could
contain number or date style values, so we distinguish them here.
Full list of message headers here: RFC3864
https://www.iana.org/assignments/message-headers/message-headers.xhtml

RFC822Address.description: Internet format for eMail addresses, specified here: https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc822/

SearchQuery.description: Search query to be executed by DQL

MessageListString.description: A String in a message list

MessageListNumber.description: A number value in a message list

MessagePart.description:
Reflects MIMEPart in MIME messages. Composed of a header and a body,
carries a Mime Type. Each message has one root Message part,
that may contain 0:n MessageParts. Inception long before the movie

Parts is an Array of messageParts, but that can't be modeled here since
most JsonSchema can't deal with recursion

Inspired by:
https://developers.google.com/gmail/api/v1/reference/users/messages

Body.description: Actual body with Base64 encoded message / attachment and size information

Headers.description: Header fields as part of a Messagepart, mainly RFC4021

Parts.description: Mime parts that are included in this mime part

MessageListItem.description: Entry in a message list, can be String, eMail, Date or Number

id.description: Id of the sucessfull created or deleted item

OOORequest.title: Root Type for OOORequest
OOORequest.description: Format how to query OOO Status

RuleInfo.title: Root Type for RuleInfo
RuleInfo.description: Payload to create a Mail rule

RulesInfo.title: Root Type for RulesInfo
RulesInfo.description: Payload to create multiple Mail rules

Message.description: An eMail message, stored natively as MIME. Represented as JSON Object.

to.description: Receipients of a message RFC822 format

bccto.description: BlindCopyTo - recipients who are not seen by any others. Big surprise when they hit replytoall RFC822 format

subject.description: Subject line of an eMail message. Must not be empty when sending

priority.description:
It has numeric values:
1 - High Priority
2 - Normal Priority
3 - Low Priority

from.description: The details of sender of email

copyto.description: Receipients who should get a copy (FYI mode) RFC822 Format

LabelActionInfo.title: Root Type for LabelActionInfo
LabelActionInfo.description: Add, remove or move documents to label.

ParentId.description: Unique Id of Label/Folder where subfolder is located

NotebookInfo.title: Root Type for NotebookInfo
NotebookInfo.description: Payload to create a notebook entry

example.Subject: TEST FROM API: I am the subject

FreeTimeQuery.title: Root Type for FreeTimeQuery
FreeTimeQuery.description: Data Structure for enquiry of available time slots per user

UpdateMessageProperty.title: Root Type for UpdateMessagePropertyRequest
UpdateMessageProperty.description: This is the parameter block for the UpdateMessageProperties request.  It allows a client to change common message propeerties on a list of documents with one request.

softDeleteOn.description: Turns on the soft delete flag.

softDeleteOff.description: Turns off the soft delete flag.

SubscriptionResult.title: Root Type for SubscriptionResult
SubscriptionResult.description: When a subscription is a pull, provides result items

more.description: Are there more events than the requested number?

SubscriptionRequest.title: Root Type for SubscriptionRequest
SubscriptionRequest.description: Subscribe to changes in a list of "folders" and subfolders to get notified using pull or push (or stream) when changes occured

SubscriptionResultItem.title: Root Type for SubscriptionResultItem
SubscriptionResultItem.description: One line of a subscription result

TaskResponse.description: Details of a "Task" that is being retrieved.

Body.description: The detailed content of the task.

Subject.description: Initial header or title of the task

Start.description: The start date of a task

DueState.description: Current state of a task. "Completed", "In Progress", "Not Started", "Overdue" or "Rejected"

TaskStatus.description: Current state of a task. "Completed", "In Progress", "Not Started", "Overdue" or "Rejected"

From.description: The one who creates and/or sends the task.

Confidential.description: the confidentiality of a task. Either true or false.

Completed.description: The date when the task was finished.

Categories.description: The type or tags of a task.

ParentFolder.description: The unique ID of the folder/view where the task is located.

Files.description: Name of the file that is uploaded in the task.

AlarmOffset.description: Time on when then alarm is set for notification.

AlarmOffsetUnit.description: Unit of measurement used by the alarm. "D" (days), "H" (hours), "M" (minutes), "S" (seconds)

TaskRequest.description: Send details to create a task.

TaskType.description: Assign the task to self or to others.

Categories.description: The types or tags of a task.

Body.description: The detailed content or description of the task.

AssignedTo.description: To whom the task is assigned. (For task that is assigned to others)

OptionalAssignedTo.description: To whom the task is assigned but optional. (For task that is assigned to others)

400badRequest.description:
Invalid request. Shows up when submission is flaky:
- Wrong authentication
- Wrong content-type
- Missing or wrong parameter types

401unauthorized.description: The system doesn't recognize you, please try with new credentials

value.message: Nice try chap, ask before next time

403forbidden.description: Forbidden. We know who you are, you just can't do this

value.message: This is not the data you seek!

405methodNotAllowed.description:
Method not allowed. You tried a GET where POST rulez or POST to an GET url.
Details in the Allow header

value.details: The haferlup needs left turning shrufti
value.message: This is not a supported operation. Try again

406notAcceptable.description:
Invalid operation - something got requested that isn't supported
Like accpt XML but we only produce JSON

415unsupportedMediaType.description:
Client uploads data in a format we don't understand
e.g. XML when we only accept JSON

500serverError.description: The server screwed up. Like NullPointers and stuff

501notImplemented.description:
Working on it, just not yet.
Defining APIs is faster than implementing them

201Created.description:
Successful creation of a resource.
Returns the ID and sometimes data

jwt.description: Regular access using JWT. Login/Logout to be handled by external provider or KEEP core API

tags.name: mail
tags.description: APIs related to create, send, retrieve and search eMail messages

tags.name: calendar
tags.description: Access to create, edit, send, propagate and act on calendar entries

tags.name: settings
tags.description: Configuration, Preferences & Settings to change behaviour of the API

tags.name: meta
tags.description: Endpoint that produce information about the API. Like OpenAPI spec, statistics etc

tags.name: subscription
tags.description: All endpoits for subscribing and retrieving changes. Mostly used by EWS
